page.title: 15ODDINGLEY:CHANGES IN TIME.
page.content: Life in this area has not changed a great deal in its landscape.The most notable change has been in the use of the canal.It was once used frequently to transport heavy loads and goods from Worcester to Birmingham.Canal transport was a major distributor in industry, but now the canals main cargo consists of leisure boats.There are a few companies that hire out barges for the use of holiday makers. The surrounding land of{Oddingley}is made up of grazing land and fields of crops.One field is known localy as {'The Pigeon House'}as in the past the pigeons gathered here.Another field has been named{'The Brick Yard' because the fields previous use was supposedly to take bricks to build local houses.Some fields are now used for the production of turf to be sold for use in the garden.
